title: 50% win rate = B4
body:
So this is my third season playing ranked.  I had a really bad first season back in 2013 and had like a 25% win rate, Then went up to around 45 % in 2014 and finished around B4 went 9 / 10 wins in preseason and dropped into B3.  This season ive ive won 50 games lost 50 games. And still havent climbed out of B3 - B4.

I get that my bad MMR from season 2013 etc is still effecting my grade ( Which is BS btw Riot) but apart from that.. 

How does a player that wins every second game and has a healthy kda stuck in the second from the bottom ranking. 

Surley there are players getting less than 50 % win rate .. How can 95 Of players ( people ranked higher than me ) win more than 50 % of games. Where are all the players winning less than 50 % of their matches ??? The maths doesnt add up..

Is the player base for B5 - B3 massive compared G5 - G3 ??

replies.body:
I dont think I deserve challenger. 

I do think im an average player, Id say average = to wining half their games..  ( that would be a fair statement )

But does a 50 % win rate equate to B3-4 ?? 

I see diamond players with 50 % win rate. So obvously im missing something.

Do i need to try impove my kda ? Take more towers  ? I normally take allot of them as I do main trynd either top or jung.

I had to win 11 games straight to gain 95ish MMR last week.. Its pretty tuff going.

Your an average bronze player though. Its you have a 50% winrate in bronze that means that is where you belong.

When I was Bronze I had like a 65% winrate and got to silver really quickly. Now in Silver my winrate is roughyl 55%. Doesn't mean I deserve gold because I win more than I lose. Means, im roughly where my skill level has peaked.

You also hae to remember that Diamonds have a 50% winrate against other diamonds... if those people were given Bronze opponents they would have like a 90% winrate.

If your winrate is 50%, you are where you belong atm.

What your missing is games played. With a 55% winrate you can climb, but it would take like 50-60 games per rank. The higher your winrate the less games (theoretically) you have to play in order to rank up.

You are not an average player, you are a below average player, your 50% win-rate doesn't mean anything, you are still bronze, Diamond players are there because they got high MMR last season and because they climbed fast but got stuck at the elo they belong in, stop comparing yourself to higher elos.

The best way to get out and improve your mmr to the point where you have nice lp gains is to practice 1/2 champs in 3 of the roles. 
You have to direct your team because in low elo, everyone runs around like headless chickens chasing kills.
 Focus on objective control. 
Focus on sharing kills so everyone in the team is strong. There is no point having someone on the team who is 20 kills up when everyone else has nothing and the enemy team has 4 kills on each player. 

I won 1/10 of my placements last season and ended up in bronze 5. 
It took me three days to climb up into bronze one where I ended the season. 
Won 7/10 placements for this season after the "soft reset" and ended up in b1 again.
I am now silver 5 even though my win rate is only 57% I still managed to do it.
50% win rate means you are not getting better, you are just sitting there

> [{quoted}](name=Biggest Gimp OCE,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=XWQ4gjVH,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-05-27T04:19:30.516+0000)
>
> 50% win rate means you are not getting better, you are just sitting there

The system is designed to try and keep you at 50%
Shaclone (name different now) had >50% win ratio yet still master I. Riots way of saying, not in gold III+ in S4 not leaving bronze

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=XWQ4gjVH,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-05-27T02:57:46.994+0000)
>
> Shaclone (name different now) had >50% win ratio yet still master I. Riots way of saying, not in gold III+ in S4 not leaving bronze

That's the most fake statement I've ever eard. If you get good you can get out of bronze. Simple as that.

its extremely hard to get out of bronze* the people there will go 1 kill over 3 turrets, they always fight and won't communicate.

Bronze is hard to escape because people don't focus on the important things, they think its all about kills. That's why most people don't get out. I managed to get up 4 ranks through it, but its still difficult with the way these people think and act. People in gold and what not have the idea on whats important, alas bronze and similar don't. Pressure, cs, objectives, 3 keys to victory. Having more cs, better pressure, communication, no harassment and more objectives usually result  in the winning team.

You know who else has no idea about any of the things you mentioned? The 5 people on the enemy team. This is VERY easy to take advantage of if you're even slightly better than them. Just remember that
exactly, I was talking about applying these to the enemy, the problem is your team is also venerable to it

Teamfight teams with a push champ usually have highest success rate, as long as your team teamfights. Had 4v5 yesterday, no adc, we won because we had a teamfight comp, applied pressure and pushed every possible chance, had to fill in our adc with the only tank tho, otherwise mr ez win :/
False, bronze is easy the only reason anybody is stuck there is because they aren't good at LoL its as simple as that, no excuses.

> [{quoted}](name=Best Viktor AU,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=XWQ4gjVH,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-05-27T02:59:47.533+0000)
>
> That's the most fake statement I've ever eard. If you get good you can get out of bronze. Simple as that.
Your a prime example of what im talking about viktor.

You have 224 wins and 212 losses but are sitting in plat.. with twice my MMR. 

Is it the fact you get twice the CS / kills / objectives ?

Or is it the fact the players you play in your games are also as high. 

Did you have a a season where you went 80 % winrate ?

Think of it this way:

Someone who starts the season with 80% win rate (in bronze, say) will climb. 

This will mean they start playing against better players and winning less.

Eventually they will get to a division where the players in their games are of equal skill to them, where they will only win 50% of games.

As they play more and more games at that division, their overall winrate will get closer and closer to 50%. (say their first 100 games are 80% winrate then the next 1000 games are 50% winrate, now overall their winrate is only 53% (and will get to about 50 eventually). Does that mean they'd only win 50% of games if they were playing with bronze players again? No.

Likewise, bad players with less than 50% winrate will drop ranks, and play against easier and easier players until they start winning half their games, at which point their winrate will also average out to 50%

Having a 50% winrate means you are at the ranking where your current skill level is. It does not mean you are equally skilled as a higher ranked player who also has a 50% winrate. If you want to climb, you need a HIGHER than 50% winrate

> [{quoted}](name=vicelore,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=XWQ4gjVH,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-27T03:18:02.472+0000)
>

> 
> You have 224 wins and 212 losses but are sitting in plat.. with twice my MMR. 
> 
> Is it the fact you get twice the CS / kills / objectives ?
> 
> Or is it the fact the players you play in your games are also as high. 
> 
> Did you have a a season where you went 80 % winrate ?

If your MMR is stable you can rank up with 51% win rate.

This is a pretty interesting topic. I find personally I started in B5, rank up to around B3 or 2, then get continuously matched with;
- trolls (actively trying to disrupt)
- AFK (never connected or d/c at beginning)
- people who get upset when something bad happens in the first 2 minutes, then either troll or AFK.

In response to original post, to rank up you'll need more wins than losses. Simple as that. Try to find a partner to duo with so you can control (be confident in) 2/5 of the team.

> [{quoted}](name=Shrewd,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=XWQ4gjVH,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-05-27T07:07:10.552+0000)
>
> This is a pretty interesting topic. I find personally I started in B5, rank up to around B3 or 2, then get continuously matched with;
> - trolls (actively trying to disrupt)
> - AFK (never connected or d/c at beginning)
> - people who get upset when something bad happens in the first 2 minutes, then either troll or AFK.
> 

Yeah I get this also. Go up to B3 then back to B5, up to B3, then back to B5. Most bronze have no idea what objectives are or map pressure, and LOVE to chase kills. A pity that I main support. I can bark at them all of the time, but when they die, they just blame me.
same problem.

If you are winning every second game, doesn't the way it works mean that every win you get LP but lose the same amount the next game? You have to go on a decent streak to progress to the next division.

Let say like this, you have 50% win rate that means you can win and can lose with 50-50 chance. Therefore, you are not better than the other. Secondly, you should she how the Gold or Diamond player play, they can have game they get smash but their cs, their objective is still stronger than the game you win in bronze. I have 2 acc, 1 is plat 5 and 1 is bronze 1 (this is my friend give to me because he's not playing anymore). My ave cs for laning heroes (not jungle and sup) is around 150 at 20 mins. Which means not really good, but compare to bronze, even they win lane really hard, their cs is about 100 at 20 mins. See the difference? Next, usually a winning team in gold or higher control dragon and other objective very good, they can push to t3 at 25~30 mins. With bronze, after winning their lane and take t1, they run around and have no idea what they doing. After that, they join team fight a lot but take no objective after each winning team fight, instead they spread out to get more farm which make me angry sometimes. So see the next difference? Winning lane in gold means their cs is away the other team around 20~30 cs or more, in bronze is they might have 2 kills but their cs is below 30~50cs which make no different. So you should see how the pro plays and said why you still stuck in bronze more than complain. It takes me 3 weeks to get from Bronze 1 to here, due to every time I got to series, they match me againts a bit higher rank and I try so hard but can't help to carry the team. So learn first then complain, ok?{{champion:69}}
SO ... how do you move up ? Whats my game lacking , As we have now established its not win rate ?

You need to carry but its something you clearly cannot do yet, if i was to play in bronze i would get out in less than a day because i would literally carry every single game, you cannot do that because your skill level is below average, learn the game.

You have a 49% win-rate actually, also you are bronze so its going to take a lot more than a 50% win-rate to climb, high elo players are there even with a 50% win-rate because they either used to be there last season or because they got massive win-streaks which made them climb high.

Your MMR is bronze and will remain bronze until you get a good win-rate, these dumb posts happen all the time and the same answer is given, get it through your head, you are exactly where you belong.

Lol last season i won 6/10 of my placements, got bronze 3, then after mid year exams i smashed through ranked throughout the holidays and climbed to silver 1

This year i won 7/10 got placed silver 3, now i'm silver 1 again.

I've never experienced being 'stuck' in bronze, my first year of league i just played 10 games for the icon, but never tried to climb due to ranked anxiety, then in 2 weeks i ranked up a division and a half.

Stop playing tryn jungle play something useful.

Also OBJECTIVES ARE MORE IMPORTANT THAN KDA. Upvote this so bronzies who think they deserve challenger can see this.

> [{quoted}](name=Best Viktor AU,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=XWQ4gjVH,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-27T02:58:41.394+0000)
>
> Stop playing tryn jungle play something useful.
> 
> Also OBJECTIVES ARE MORE IMPORTANT THAN KDA. Upvote this so bronzies who think they deserve challenger can see this.

Open to suggestions, Ive found he carries harder than most champs. 

I try play him top but get stuck in jung allot.

PS hes by far my best champ with 38/26 59.4% win rate
try playing comps that absolutely decimate teamfights, winning a teamfight will give you more windows to get objectives

It's not win rate, it's ELO. If you are pre-empted as winning a game and you lose it, you will lose more MMR and/or ELO so you can effectively win the games it expects you to - but if you lose games ELO predicts you to win - IE easy games or slightly harder games, you will lose more LP for it, hence ELO and/or MMR and will not climb.

Try winning those hard games, you will get more MMR for it and essentially climb - your win rate has less to do with your ranking than whether you are winning easy games and/or losing easy games occasionally.

This will heavily cut your LP. Winning the easy games will only gain you so much and in reality you could be sitting at a stable 50% win rate - the whole way on your decline from Master tier to Bronze 5.
I take it by that your referring to the 21>11 lp wins
